BitField.Name: UDEN
BitField.Description: Under-drive enable in stop mode These bits are set by software. They allow to achieve a lower power consumption in Stop mode but with a longer wakeup time. When set, the digital area has less leakage consumption when the device enters Stop mode. 00: Under-drive disable 01: Reserved 10: Reserved 11:Under-drive enable

BitField.Name: ODSWEN
BitField.Description: Over-drive switching enabled. This bit is set by software. It is cleared automatically by hardware after exiting from Stop mode or when the ODEN bit is reset. When set, It is used to switch to Over-drive mode. To set or reset the ODSWEN bit, the HSI or HSE must be selected as system clock. The ODSWEN bit must only be set when the ODRDY flag is set to switch to Over-drive mode. 0: Over-drive switching disabled 1: Over-drive switching enabled Note: On any over-drive switch (enabled or disabled), the system clock will be stalled during the internal voltage set up.

BitField.Name: ODEN
BitField.Description: Over-drive enable This bit is set by software. It is cleared automatically by hardware after exiting from Stop mode. It is used to enabled the Over-drive mode in order to reach a higher frequency. To set or reset the ODEN bit, the HSI or HSE must be selected as system clock. When the ODEN bit is set, the application must first wait for the Over-drive ready flag (ODRDY) to be set before setting the ODSWEN bit. 0: Over-drive disabled 1: Over-drive enabled

BitField.Name: VOS
BitField.Description: Regulator voltage scaling output selection These bits control the main internal voltage regulator output voltage to achieve a trade-off between performance and power consumption when the device does not operate at the maximum frequency (refer to the STM32F42xx and STM32F43xx datasheets for more details). These bits can be modified only when the PLL is OFF. The new value programmed is active only when the PLL is ON. When the PLL is OFF, the voltage scale 3 is automatically selected. 00: Reserved (Scale 3 mode selected) 01: Scale 3 mode 10: Scale 2 mode 11: Scale 1 mode (reset value)

BitField.Name: ADCDC1
BitField.Description: 0: No effect. 1: Refer to AN4073 for details on how to use this bit. Note: This bit can only be set when operating at supply voltage range 2.7 to 3.6V and when the Prefetch is OFF.

BitField.Name: MRUDS
BitField.Description: Main regulator in deepsleep under-drive mode This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Main regulator ON when the device is in Stop mode 1: Main Regulator in under-drive mode and Flash memory in power-down when the device is in Stop under-drive mode.

BitField.Name: LPUDS
BitField.Description: Low-power regulator in deepsleep under-drive mode This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: Low-power regulator ON if LPDS bit is set when the device is in Stop mode 1: Low-power regulator in under-drive mode if LPDS bit is set and Flash memory in powerdown when the device is in Stop under-drive mode.

BitField.Name: FPDS
BitField.Description: Flash power-down in Stop mode When set, the Flash memory enters power-down mode when the device enters Stop mode. This allows to achieve a lower consumption in stop mode but a longer restart time. 0: Flash memory not in power-down when the device is in Stop mode 1: Flash memory in power-down when the device is in Stop mode

BitField.Name: DBP
BitField.Description: Disable backup domain write protection In reset state, the RCC_BDCR register, the RTC registers (including the backup registers), and the BRE bit of the PWR_CSR register, are protected against parasitic write access. This bit must be set to enable write access to these registers. 0: Access to RTC and RTC Backup registers and backup SRAM disabled 1: Access to RTC and RTC Backup registers and backup SRAM enabled

BitField.Name: PLS
BitField.Description: PVD level selection These bits are written by software to select the voltage threshold detected by the Power Voltage Detector 000: 2.0 V 001: 2.1 V 010: 2.3 V 011: 2.5 V 100: 2.6 V 101: 2.7 V 110: 2.8 V 111: 2.9 V Note: Refer to the electrical characteristics of the datasheet for more details.

BitField.Name: PVDE
BitField.Description: Power voltage detector enable This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: PVD disabled 1: PVD enabled

BitField.Name: CSBF
BitField.Description: Clear standby flag This bit is always read as 0. 0: No effect 1: Clear the SBF Standby Flag (write).

BitField.Name: CWUF
BitField.Description: Clear wakeup flag This bit is always read as 0. 0: No effect 1: Clear the WUF Wakeup Flag after 2 System clock cycles

BitField.Name: PDDS
BitField.Description: Power-down deepsleep This bit is set and cleared by software. It works together with the LPDS bit. 0: Enter Stop mode when the CPU enters deepsleep. The regulator status depends on the LPDS bit. 1: Enter Standby mode when the CPU enters deepsleep.

BitField.Name: LPDS
BitField.Description: Low-power deepsleep This bit is set and cleared by software. It works together with the PDDS bit. 0:Main voltage regulator ON during Stop mode 1: Low-power voltage regulator ON during Stop mode

BitField.Name: UDRDY
BitField.Description: Under-drive ready flag These bits are set by hardware when the Under-drive mode is enabled in Stop mode and cleared by programming them to 1. 00: Under-drive is disabled 01: Reserved 10: Reserved 11:Under-drive mode is activated in Stop mode.

BitField.Name: ODSWRDY
BitField.Description: Over-drive mode switching ready 0: Over-drive mode is not active. 1: Over-drive mode is active on digital area on 1.2 V domain

BitField.Name: ODRDY
BitField.Description: Over-drive mode ready 0: Over-drive mode not ready. 1: Over-drive mode ready

BitField.Name: VOSRDY
BitField.Description: Regulator voltage scaling output selection ready bit 0: Not ready 1: Ready

BitField.Name: BRE
BitField.Description: Backup regulator enable When set, the Backup regulator (used to maintain backup SRAM content in Standby and VBAT modes) is enabled. If BRE is reset, the backup regulator is switched off. The backup SRAM can still be used but its content will be lost in the Standby and VBAT modes. Once set, the application must wait that the Backup Regulator Ready flag (BRR) is set to indicate that the data written into the RAM will be maintained in the Standby and VBAT modes. 0: Backup regulator disabled 1: Backup regulator enabled Note: This bit is not reset when the device wakes up from Standby mode, by a system reset, or by a power reset.

BitField.Name: EWUP
BitField.Description: Enable WKUP pin This bit is set and cleared by software. 0: WKUP pin is used for general purpose I/O. An event on the WKUP pin does not wakeup the device from Standby mode. 1: WKUP pin is used for wakeup from Standby mode and forced in input pull down configuration (rising edge on WKUP pin wakes-up the system from Standby mode). Note: This bit is reset by a system reset.

BitField.Name: BRR
BitField.Description: Backup regulator ready Set by hardware to indicate that the Backup Regulator is ready. 0: Backup Regulator not ready 1: Backup Regulator ready Note: This bit is not reset when the device wakes up from Standby mode or by a system reset or power reset.

BitField.Name: PVDO
BitField.Description: PVD output This bit is set and cleared by hardware. It is valid only if PVD is enabled by the PVDE bit. 0: VDD is higher than the PVD threshold selected with the PLS[2:0] bits. 1: VDD is lower than the PVD threshold selected with the PLS[2:0] bits. Note: The PVD is stopped by Standby mode. For this reason, this bit is equal to 0 after Standby or reset until the PVDE bit is set.

BitField.Name: SBF
BitField.Description: Standby flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared only by a POR/PDR (power-on reset/power-down reset) or by setting the CSBF bit in the PWR power control register (PWR_CR) for STM32F405xx/07xx and STM32F415xx/17xx 0: Device has not been in Standby mode 1: Device has been in Standby mode

BitField.Name: WUF
BitField.Description: Wakeup flag This bit is set by hardware and cleared either by a system reset or by setting the CWUF bit in the PWR_CR register. 0: No wakeup event occurred 1: A wakeup event was received from the WKUP pin or from the RTC alarm (Alarm A or Alarm B), RTC Tamper event, RTC TimeStamp event or RTC Wakeup). Note: An additional wakeup event is detected if the WKUP pin is enabled (by setting the EWUP bit) when the WKUP pin level is already high.
